directions: Preheat oven to 350 F. Line baking sheet with parchment paper.
Whisk together flour, psyllium husks, salt, baking powder, and baking soda until they have become one colour.

Add cold butter to bowl of stand mixer and mix with paddle attachment until creamy. Add brown sugar and sucanat. Blend on medium speed until mixture is light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Use spatula to scrape down side of the bowl. Add egg and mix until all traces of the egg disappear into the butter. Mix in vanilla.
ingredients: 7½ oz (210 g) whole-grain gluten-free flour mix (see recipe)
1 tsp (5 mL) whole or powdered psyllium husks
8 tbsp (120 mL) cold, unsalted butter, cut into 1-inch pieces
½ cup (125 mL) dark brown sugar, packed
½ cup (125 mL) sucanat or white sugar
11/3 cup (320 mL) bittersweet chocolate, roughly chopped into ½-inch (1 cm) pieces
title: Chocolate Chip Cookies with Hazelnuts
